sect1.title: The XML Factories API
sect1.para: Details about the implementation can be found in JavaDoc. All the XML Schema files are stored directly in the cz.cuni.mff.been.jaxb package directory.

sect2.title: The XSD Enumeration
sect2.para: Each XML Schema used by the BEEN framework is represented by a member of the XSD enumeration. The member lists all the files necessary to instantiate the schema and inherits the following generic interface:

These methods create parsers and composers of the required type. The supplied class definition match the type of the enumeration member. Only classes bound to the corresponding XML Schema can be used.
In some special cases, such as self-contained parsers that have an XML Schema stored in a static String literal, XML Schema instances can be produced extrenally, using a utility method.

sect2.title: Factory Singletons
sect2.para: The Factory class contains factory singletons for all the possible XML bound data types. These singletons should be used instead of instantiating factories manually.
